item.title: Advice to all those wo do NOT want to waste time on thinking about their money
item.description: Thinking about your finances Wealth and hapiness How to grow your wealth Gold Savings account Real estate Government bonds Stocks What I would do Buy… Allocation: 2/1/100 …or rent? Allocation 2/1/50:50 Thinking about your finances I know that actively thinking about one’s finances is difficult. For one reason because it involves feelings about what we do with our money? Some people may feel guilt for not saving enough and spending too much on leisure while others may be terrified and fear the thought of loosing their fortune.

item.title: Active Investor Signals
item.description: About the system The Active Investor Signals (AIS) system aims to trade individual stocks, stock index funds as well as a variety of ETFs adopting a medium to long term investment style. The criteria for investment are a mix of quantitative tests and discretionary decisions. Quantitative methods include backtesting of rule-based strategies and statistical analysis of historical price movements. Discretionary decisions gauge the quantitative elements in the light of macroeconomic cycles and money management.
